result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L. Denson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no assaultive contact with victims; J.M.R., DOB: 01-26-1970 and M.A.D., DOB: 06-11-1989.

Undergo mental health assessment and follow through;

Undergo domestic violence assessment and follow through.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

($380.00 of these costs are from count 3, which have been ordered paid as a condition of probation on count 2)

2:03 PM Defendant Patrick L. Denson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim in court for Patrick L. Denson.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement: Yes, April 18, 2022
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Plea date scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea date on April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:38 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick L. Denson appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim in court for Patrick L. Denson. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:54 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Patrick L. Denson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant, by zoom.  More time requested to appoint counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 02-11-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping, resist/obstruct officer and disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with M.A.D., DOb: 06-11-1999.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on probation hold.  Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
